segments.text: I notice the boy is really stretching to get those cookies, and the stool is so unstable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is just standing there, waiting for her share like it’s normal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is completely oblivious to everything happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is overflowing, and she’s just drying dishes like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll ever turn around and see the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is getting bigger, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the floor is going to be ruined by the time someone notices.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is so focused on the cookies that he doesn’t even see how dangerous this is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm the garden looks outside while this chaos is happening inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is such a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
